content: Indemnification: Clauses requiring one party to compensate the other for losses.. Indicators: indemnify, hold harmless, defend against, liable for all claims. Mitigation: Cap the indemnification amount Limit to direct damages only Exclude gross negligence/willful misconduct

metadata.description: Clauses requiring one party to compensate the other for losses.

content: Limitation of Liability: Clauses limiting the amount one party has to pay if they are sued.. Indicators: aggregate liability, consequential damages, lost profits, maximum liability. Mitigation: Ensure mutual limitation Set a reasonable cap (e.g., 12 months fees) Explicitly exclude consequential damages

metadata.description: Clauses limiting the amount one party has to pay if they are sued.
severity_factors: Cap is too high (e.g., > 2x contract value)
mitigation_strategy: Set a reasonable cap (e.g., 12 months fees)

content: Termination: Conditions under which the contract can be ended.. Indicators: terminate for convenience, material breach, notice period, automatic renewal. Mitigation: Negotiate right to terminate for convenience Shorten notice periods Require written notice for renewal

metadata.description: Conditions under which the contract can be ended.
mitigation_strategy: Negotiate right to terminate for convenience

content: Confidentiality: Obligations to keep shared information secret.. Indicators: confidential information, trade secrets, non-disclosure, proprietary data. Mitigation: Define specific categories of confidential info Set a time limit (e.g., 3-5 years) Standard exceptions (public domain, court order)

metadata.description: Obligations to keep shared information secret.
mitigation_strategy: Define specific categories of confidential info

content: Jurisdiction & Governing Law: Which laws apply and where disputes will be settled.. Indicators: governed by the laws of, exclusive jurisdiction, venue, arbitration. Mitigation: Neutral jurisdiction Home court advantage if possible Allow for mediation before arbitration

metadata.description: Which laws apply and where disputes will be settled.

content: Payment Terms: When and how payments are made.. Indicators: net 30, net 60, late fees, interest, invoicing. Mitigation: Standard Net 30 terms Cap late fees Dispute resolution mechanism for invoices

metadata.description: When and how payments are made.

content: Intellectual Property: Ownership of work product and pre-existing IP.. Indicators: work made for hire, assigns all rights, perpetual license, moral rights. Mitigation: Clearly distinguish background IP vs. deliverables Grant license instead of assignment where appropriate Retain rights to generic tools/methods

metadata.description: Ownership of work product and pre-existing IP.
mitigation_strategy: Clearly distinguish background IP vs. deliverables
Grant license instead of assignment where appropriate

content: Non-Compete: Restrictions on working with competitors.. Indicators: non-compete, exclusivity, restrictive covenant, similar business. Mitigation: Remove if possible Narrow scope to specific direct competitors Limit duration to contract term

severity_factors: Prevents doing business with other clients
mitigation_strategy: Narrow scope to specific direct competitors
